High school football takes center stage in Mass.

(Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe)
High School Super Bowl games are underway at Gillette Stadium, Bentley University, and Curry College. Follow our live updates as we cover all nine games.

Report: Kansas City Chiefs player involved in deadly shooting

A Kansas City TV station is reporting that a Chiefs player apparently shot and killed his girlfriend, then killed himself. (Globe, 10:56 a.m.)

Snow will end this afternoon

Snow will move eastward after coating the ground and giving some areas 1 inch, but will lighten later today, meteorologist David Epstein writes. (Globe, 11:09 a.m.)

Police: 2nd person dead in Fla. bus crash

A bus hit an overpass at Miami International Airport, killing two people and injuring more than two dozen on board, officials said. (AP, 10:55 a.m.)

Warren launches tour of state

Senator-elect Elizabeth Warren said she wants to thank those who supported her and "open the door" to everyone in the state, regardless of how they voted. (AP)

on compounding pharmacy

Since Alexandra Zapp’s 2002 murder at the hands of a longtime sexual predator, her parents have been devoted to a single purpose: trying to stem the tide of sexual violence.

TCBY will try again in Mass.

TCBY plans to open 15 to 25 self-serve shops in the Boston area over the next few years, saying that giving customers more control has revived the business.
Opinion | JOAN WICKERSHAM

An ideal holiday film

The problem with most Christmas movies is, well, Christmas. The 1957 film “Desk Set,” however, just happens to occur between November and January.

NStar faces scrutiny over outages

NStar is facing more questions after Thursday's power outage in Cambridge, the latest in a string of disruptions this year caused by equipment failures.
